meanings.definition: A thing to be held or retained.
meanings.sent1: I always keep my habendums close to me.
meanings.sent2: The treasure chest contained various habendums.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel collected shiny habendums for its nest.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were precious habendums she treasured.
meanings.sent5: The old book was filled with forgotten habendums.

meanings.definition: A clause in a deed or legal document specifying the property to be granted.
meanings.sent1: The habendums in the contract outlined the land boundaries.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer carefully reviewed the habendums of the agreement.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy chewed on the important habendums.
meanings.sent4: The habendums in the will determined the inheritance.
meanings.sent5: The judge examined the crucial habendums of the case.
